body_html:
I used mpstat to monitor the threads while running. When using MKL_NUM_THREADS, all cores are being utilized but if I had to guess it seems like the overhead drops the performance.
When using OMP_NUM_THREADS it continues to run on 1 core at a time, which explains the performance not changing.
body_text:
I used mpstat to monitor the threads while running. When using MKL_NUM_THREADS, all cores are being utilized but if I had to guess it seems like the overhead drops the performance.
When using OMP_NUM_THREADS it continues to run on 1 core at a time, which explains the performance not changing.
body:
I used ```mpstat``` to monitor the threads while running. When using MKL_NUM_THREADS, all cores are being utilized but if I had to guess it seems like the overhead drops the performance.
When using OMP_NUM_THREADS it continues to run on 1 core at a time, which explains the performance not changing.
